Problem:
Consider the system governed by a complex function \\( z(t) = u(t) + iv(t) \\), where \\( u(t) \\) and \\( v(t) \\) are real-valued functions of time t, and i is the imaginary unit. We study the influence of the integral transformation defined by \\( f(z) = \int_0^t e^{At} z(s) \, ds \\) where A is a constant complex matrix.

After observing the transformed output \\( f(z)(t) \\) at time T, can we exactly reconstruct the original function \\( z(0) \\) up to time T without any knowledge whether the transformation was applied?
Explanation: The transformation \\( f(z) \\) incorporates the matrix exponential \\( e^{At} \\) which blends the influence of time evolution of z, making it impossible to uniquely deduce the function \\( z(0) \\) up to T only from the output \\( f(z)(t) \\) due to irreversible integration and possible many-to-one mappings.
